title: Eczema Symptoms
author: Annie Stuart

content: When people talk about eczema , they usually mean atopic dermatitis , its most common form. But eczema is the name for a group of skin conditions. They all cause red, itchy, and often cracked skin, but there are also different symptoms for each type.

content_blocks.text: When people talk about eczema , they usually mean atopic dermatitis , its most common form. But eczema is the name for a group of skin conditions. They all cause red, itchy, and often cracked skin, but there are also different symptoms for each type.

sections.heading: Atopic Dermatitis
content: This form of eczema starts with an intense itch . Once you give in to the urge to scratch, the telltale rash begins. When skin is very irritated, it can crack and bleed or ooze clear fluid.
The main symptoms are the same for almost everyone, but how often they happen, and how severe they are, vary from person to person. There are also some key differences, depending on your age.
Symptoms in babies:
A skin infection may develop if your baby rubs the affected area.
Symptoms in children:
bullets: Appears mostly on the scalp and cheeks
Dry, itchy skin
Scales
Lesions that may ooze
Fussiness and trouble sleeping because of itching
Eczema appears most often inside the elbows and behind the knees. It can also be on the neck, wrists, or ankles , or the area between the buttocks and the creases at the top of the thighs.

content: This form of eczema is irritation or an allergic reaction to something that comes into contact with your skin, especially your hands or face. Symptoms may include:
The skin can become thick, leathery, and cracked after repeated contact with your triggers.

sections.heading: Dyshidrotic Eczema
content: This eczema is named after the term that means “disordered sweat.” It was once thought to be a problem with sweat glands. Signs appear only on the palms of the hands, the sides of the fingers, and sometimes the soles of the feet . When you have an outbreak, symptoms often follow this pattern:
Over time, skin looks inflamed and scaly and gets cracks. Your nails may change color, thicken, and be ridged or pitted.
bullets: Severe itchiness and possibly pain or tingling, followed by tiny, itchy blisters
Groups of blisters that may join together into bigger blisters
Obvious sweat on blistered areas
Peeling skin after the blisters go away

sections.heading: Nummular Eczema
content: Nummular means “coin-like.” This form of eczema gets its name from the shape of the patches it creates, most often on your legs, forearms, or hands. Symptoms include:
bullets: Tiny bumps that form after a skin injury, get crusty, and merge to make scaly coin shapes
Intense itching, burning, or stinging that gets worse when sitting still or sleeping
Dry skin between the patches
Darkening of your regular skin color as the patches go away

sections.heading: Seborrheic Dermatitis
content: This form of dermatitis often affects the scalp, especially in infants, and other areas rich in oil (or sebaceous) glands. It may go away in childhood but return in the teen years (especially in boys) and in adulthood. Unlike many other forms of eczema , it’s not always itchy.
Symptoms in babies include scaly and greasy patches on the scalp. It may affect the buttocks. It’s usually limited to infancy.
Symptoms in teens and adults:
bullets: Scaly, greasy, flaky patches on the scalp, on the eyebrows, and around the nostrils, in the beard area and possibly on the chest, back and groin
Inflammation , redness, and swelling
Flares that may be triggered by things like dry, cold weather and stress

sections.heading: Stasis Dermatitis
content: This form of eczema is linked to blood flow problems like varicose veins . It tends to happen in the lower legs and around the ankles. Symptoms include:
Stasis dermatitis can lead to:
bullets: Dry, discolored skin over the problem veins
Itchiness that often spreads to the top of the foot
Swelling and discomfort in the leg or ankle that gets worse during the day and better when you sleep
Skin that darkens and becomes tough and scaly from the skin and the calf to the foot
Very itchy and painful skin
Sores that easily bleed

sections.heading: Neurodermatitis
content: This is an unusual form of eczema that usually causes just one or two patches on a specific area, like the nape of the neck, the scalp, the eyelids, or the arms. Patches can even appear around the genitals or anus. Symptoms include:
Once a raised patch develops, it may:
bullets: An intense itch that worsens as you scratch or rub it
Itching that gets worse with stress or while sleeping
Pain from scratching
Look scaly, thick, and leathery
Change color to red or violet from scratching
Develop sores that bleed
Become even itchier

sections.heading: From Mild to Severe: How Serious Is Your Eczema?
content: The seriousness of eczema symptoms can vary a great deal between people. With mild eczema, you may have nothing more than small areas of dry skin that get a bit itchy from time to time.

In more serious cases, eczema inflames skin all over your body and causes relentless itching that can be hard to ignore. It might even be hard to focus on school or work. In addition, you may scratch in your sleep, causing cuts and tears that lead to regular infection.
The inflammation often reddens lighter-colored skin noticeably. It may be harder to see on darker skin, but it sometimes causes gray, purple, or darker brown coloration.

sections.heading: When to Call Your Doctor About Eczema
content: No matter what type of eczema you might have, schedule a visit if:
bullets: You get an itchy rash and have a family history of eczema or asthma .
The inflammation doesn't respond within a week to treatment with over-the-counter hydrocortisone creams. You may need stronger forms of treatment.

You get yellowish to light brown crust or pus-filled blisters over patches of eczema, especially if you’ve been scratching. You could have a bacterial infection that should be treated with an antibiotic. In fact, you’re also more likely to get viral and fungal skin infections.
During a flare-up of eczema, avoid contact with anyone with a viral skin disease such as cold sores or genital herpes . Having eczema puts you at higher risk of catching the herpes simplex virus .
You get many painful, small, fluid-filled blisters in the areas of eczema. You may have eczema herpeticum, a rare but potentially serious complication caused by the herpes simplex virus.
